messages.messageBody:
>>So, I'd like to ask you, Leslie, to describe how you believe schools
"reinforce dysfunction," and how you feel that your former
attitudes also did similar damage to your kids, and what you do in your
unschooling not to damage your kids the way schools do.>>

>>Does she get a grade for answering this essay question?
I'm glad I'm not Leslie. That's too much pressure!>>

Hey, I DID write an essay that's sort of on this topic! (Here's the
shameless self-promotion part ;-)) I'm not sure what the phrase "reinforce
dysfunction" means, but I did write an article about my former attitudes
towards school, the damage done to my son, and the healing that unschooling
has brought. It'll be in the Nov/Dec issue of HEM. <<shamless plug,
shameless plug, shameless plug>>

And yet, I still don't want to get into a *school sucks* discussion here. I
like to focus on the joy. THAT was the final point of my article.

Life is good.
~Mary
